note.p: Birth: Crosby Grange, near Northallerton, Yorkshire, England (c1756)
Death: Hinganghat, 50 miles from Nagpore, India (26 January 1823)

Career: Ensign in Lord Fauconberg's regiment (1781); later served in the 33rd (West Riding) regiment in India; Brigade Major to General David Baird in an expedition against Seringapatam; surveyed Malabar and Coromandel coasts; Captain (1806); Major (1808); Lieutenant Colonel (1814); died of pulmonary disease
References: James R Smith, 'Sir George Everest, FRS (1790-1866)' in NR 1992 vol 46 pp 89-102
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332

Notes: There is some confusion as to Lambton's birth year as he seems to have not publically talked about this information. ODNB has his birth year as 1753. Similarly, there is little information on his parentage, with assumptions in some sources being made as to Lambton coming from a poor background.
